data.title: The Complete Guide to Breast Cancer
data.subtitle: How to Feel Empowered and Take Control
data.content: Authors: Professor Trisha Greenhalgh and Dr Liz O'Riordan. Written by a breast cancer consultant oncologist and a GP who both got breast cancer themselves, this book was a fantastic resource. I found it more uselful than all the separate pamphlets (though I read all those too!) and found myself coming back to it over and over. Easy to read and digest, lots of great advice, information, underpinned by science and clinical guidence. Can't reccommend it enough.

data.title: Moving Through Cancer
data.subtitle: An Exercise and Strength-Training Program for the Fight of Your Life - Empowers Patients and Caregivers in 5 Steps
data.content: Author: Kathryn Schmitz. This was a book which enabled me to feel empowered to exercise during treatment in a way that felt safe. Easy to read and understand with excellent scientific underpinning.

data.title: You, Me and the Big C
data.subtitle: Putting the can in cancer
data.content: After I got diagnosed, I went right back to the first episode of this podcast and made my way through them all. Open, honest, frank conversations between people who know where you're at.

data.title: Donâ€˜t Ignore the Elephant
data.subtitle: Samantha Evans: How to get sex and intimacy back in your life
data.content: Intimacy is hard at the best of times. Ongoing oestrogen suppresion, getting to grips with your body after cancer treatment, trauma and grief, really put a spanner in the works. In this podcast Liz O'Riordan talks candidly to Samantha Evans about sex
